trans-unit.source: Specifies that the type has a visualizer.
This class cannot be inherited.
This attribute can be used at the assembly level.
Typically the attribute constructors take two types.
The two types are a visualizer and a visualizer object source, specified as types or as fully qualified assembly type names.
The second option is provided so that the visualizer assembly does not need to be referenced by the assembly containing the <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute>.
This allows a component creator to ship the visualizer in a DLL to be called only at debug time.
The <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute.Description%2A> property specifies the visualizer description that appears in the drop-down box.
The target parameters specify the type that is the target of the visualizer.
For more information about visualizers, see [Create Custom Visualizers](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/c24c006f-f2ac-429f-89db-677fc0c6e1ea).
Visualizer and visualizer object source implementation is dependent upon the hosting debugger.

For information on creating a visualizer for [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)], see [How to: Write a Visualizer](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/625a0d4f-abcc-43f2-9f8c-31c131a4378e).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute"></xref> class, specifying the type name of the visualizer.
The <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute> can be applied to assemblies, classes, and structures.
For information on the use of this attribute, see [How to: Write a Visualizer](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/625a0d4f-abcc-43f2-9f8c-31c131a4378e).
The fully qualified type name of the visualizer.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute"></xref> class, specifying the type of the visualizer.
The <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute> can be applied to assemblies, classes, and structures.
For information on the use of this attribute, see [How to: Write a Visualizer](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/625a0d4f-abcc-43f2-9f8c-31c131a4378e).
The type of the visualizer.
visualizer is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute"></xref> class, specifying the type name of the visualizer and the type name of the visualizer object source.
The <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute> can be applied to assemblies, classes, and structures.
For information on the use of this attribute, see [How to: Write a Visualizer](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/625a0d4f-abcc-43f2-9f8c-31c131a4378e).
The fully qualified type name of the visualizer.
The fully qualified type name of the visualizer object source.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute"></xref> class, specifying the type name of the visualizer and the type of the visualizer object source.
The <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute> can be applied to assemblies, classes, and structures.
For information on the use of this attribute, see [How to: Write a Visualizer](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/625a0d4f-abcc-43f2-9f8c-31c131a4378e).
The fully qualified type name of the visualizer.
The type of the visualizer object source.
visualizerObjectSource is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute"></xref> class, specifying the type of the visualizer and the type name of the visualizer object source.
The <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute> can be applied to assemblies, classes, and structures.
For information on the use of this attribute, see [How to: Write a Visualizer](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/625a0d4f-abcc-43f2-9f8c-31c131a4378e).
The type of the visualizer.
The fully qualified type name of the visualizer object source.
visualizer is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute"></xref> class, specifying the type of the visualizer and the type of the visualizer object source.
The <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerVisualizerAttribute> can be applied to assemblies, classes, and structures.
For information on the use of this attribute, see [How to: Write a Visualizer](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/625a0d4f-abcc-43f2-9f8c-31c131a4378e).
The type of the visualizer.
The type of the visualizer object source.
visualizerObjectSource is `null`.
Gets or sets the description of the visualizer.
The description of the visualizer.
Gets or sets the target type when the attribute is applied at the assembly level.
The type that is the target of the visualizer.
The value cannot be set because it is `null`.
Gets or sets the fully qualified type name when the attribute is applied at the assembly level.
If the target was specified by type (rather than by type name), the name returned is the <xref:System.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName%2A> property of the target type.
The fully qualified type name of the target type.
Gets the fully qualified type name of the visualizer object source.
If the visualizer object source was specified by its type, then the value returned is the <xref:System.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName%2A> property of the visualizer object source type.
A visualizer object source created for [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)] should inherit from the [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)] class `VisualizerObjectSource` class.
For information on creating a visualizer, see [How to: Write a Visualizer](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/625a0d4f-abcc-43f2-9f8c-31c131a4378e).
The fully qualified type name of the visualizer object source.
Gets the fully qualified type name of the visualizer.
If the visualizer was specified by its type, then the value returned is the <xref:System.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName%2A> property for the visualizer type.
For information on creating a visualizer, see [How to: Write a Visualizer](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/625a0d4f-abcc-43f2-9f8c-31c131a4378e).
The fully qualified visualizer type name.
